citations.narrative:
***On September 17, 2025 a female capuchin was able to get out of her enclosure. It was determined that she was able
to bend enclosure wires due to a loose weld and get through the opening. While she was out of the enclosure she was
able to leave the property and was hit by a car. On September 23, 2025 she was located, retrieved and taken to the
veterinary clinic where it was determined she did not obtain any critical injuries, she was monitored in clinic and then
returned to the zoo on September 27, 2025.
All enclosures shall be constructed to contain the nonhuman primates securely and prevent accidental opening of the
enclosure, including opening by the animal.
To be corrected by 9/27/2025 and prior to placing any animals in the enclosure.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the President.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(iii)  Direct
   
Primary enclosures. 
***On September 17, 2025 a female capuchin was able to get out of her enclosure. It was determined that she was able 
to bend enclosure wires due to a loose weld and get through the opening. While she was out of the enclosure she was 
able to leave the property and was hit by a car. On September 23, 2025 she was located, retrieved and taken to the 
veterinary clinic where it was determined she did not obtain any critical injuries, she was monitored in clinic and then 
returned to the zoo on September 27, 2025. 
 
All enclosures shall be constructed to contain the nonhuman primates securely and prevent accidental opening of the 
enclosure, including opening by the animal.  
 
To be corrected by 9/27/2025 and prior to placing any animals in the enclosure. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the President.
